module_1.question: A data set contains the values 2, 2, 9, 9, 9, 16, 16, 16, 16, 26, 26, and 26. Which of the following frequency tables correctly represents this data set?
module_1.hint: Count how many times each unique number appears in the data set.
solution: Count occurrences: 2 appears 2 times, 9 appears 3 times, 16 appears 4 times, 26 appears 3 times
Option B correctly shows these frequencies

module_1.question: Which expression is equivalent to \(x^2 - x - 56\)?
module_1.hint: Find two numbers that multiply to -56 and add to -1.
solution: Need two numbers that multiply to -56 and add to -1

module_1.question: A carpenter hammers 10 nails per minute and installs 7 screws per minute during a project. Which of the following equations represents the scenario if the carpenter hammers nails for \(x\) minutes, installs screws for \(y\) minutes, and uses a combined total of 200 nails and screws?
module_1.hint: Multiply the rate (nails or screws per minute) by the time in minutes.

module_1.question: What is the measure of angle F in the triangle DEF, where angle D is \(73°\) and angle E is \(35°\)?
module_1.hint: The sum of angles in a triangle is \(180°\).
solution: Sum of angles in a triangle: \(D + E + F = 180°\)

module_1.question: The total amount of plastic remaining to be recycled in a facility over \(x\) shifts is represented by the graph. The graph shows a line starting from a point on the positive y-axis and decreasing linearly to a point on the positive x-axis. Which of the following represents the y-intercept of the graph?

options.A: The total amount of plastic remaining at any given time
options.B: The number of shifts it will take to finish recycling the plastic
options.C: The amount of plastic that is recycled per shift
options.D: The initial amount of plastic to be recycled

module_1.hint: The y-intercept occurs when \(x = 0\) (before any shifts have occurred).
solution: The y-intercept is the value of \(y\) when \(x = 0\)
When \(x = 0\), no shifts have occurred yet
Therefore, the y-intercept represents the initial amount of plastic to be recycled

module_1.question:
The table below shows the condition and subject type for 200 textbooks at a bookstore.

\[\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
 & \text{Biology} & \text{Chemistry} & \text{Physics} & \text{Anatomy} & \text{Total} \\\hline
\text{Used} & 10 & 25 & 30 & 15 & 80 \\\hline
\text{New} & 30 & 25 & 10 & 55 & 120 \\\hline
\text{Total} & 40 & 50 & 40 & 70 & 200 \\\hline
\end{array}\]

What is the probability that a textbook chosen at random will be a new textbook? (Express your answer as a decimal or fraction, not as a percent.)
module_1.hint: Probability = (Number of new textbooks) / (Total number of textbooks).

module_1.question: A random sample of 5,000 students out of 60,000 undergraduate students at a university were surveyed about a potential change to the registration system. According to the survey results, 75% of the respondents did not support the existing registration system, with a 4% margin of error. Which of the following represents a reasonable total number of students who did not support the existing registration system?
module_1.hint: Apply the survey percentage to the entire population, considering the margin of error.
solution: Survey result: 75% did not support (margin of error: ±4%)
Option D (43,800) falls within this reasonable range

module_1.question: What is the negative solution to the equation \(\frac{32}{a} = a - 4\)?
module_1.hint: Multiply both sides by \(a\) and rearrange to form a quadratic equation.

module_1.question: After a hot air balloon is launched from a plateau 1,000 meters above sea level, it rises at a constant rate of 750 meters per minute. Which of the following best describes the function used to model the balloon's distance above sea level over time?
module_1.hint: The balloon rises at a constant rate, which indicates a linear relationship.
solution: The balloon rises at a constant rate of 750 meters per minute
Constant rate of change = linear function
The balloon is rising (going up) = increasing

module_1.question: What is the x-intercept of the function \(f(x) = (22)^x - 1\) when it is graphed in the xy-plane, where \(y = f(x)\)?
module_1.hint: The x-intercept occurs when \(y = 0\), so set \(f(x) = 0\) and solve for \(x\).
solution: Any number to the power of 0 equals 1: \(x = 0\)

module_1.question: In parallelogram ABCD, the length of AB is one-third the length of AD. The perimeter of the parallelogram is 64. What is the length of AB?
module_1.hint: In a parallelogram, opposite sides are equal. Set up an equation using the perimeter.
solution: In a parallelogram, opposite sides are equal: \(AB = CD\) and \(AD = BC\)

module_1.question: A triangle with an area of 18 square units has a base of \((m + 5)\) units and a height of \(m\) units. What is the value of \(m\)?
module_1.hint: Use the formula for the area of a triangle: \(A = \frac{1}{2} \times \text{base} \times \text{height}\).

module_1.question:
The table shows the exponential growth of a type of yeast over time \(s\), in seconds. There are \(c\) total yeast colonies on the count plate. What is the equation that represents this relationship, assuming that no yeast was added or removed after counting began?

\[\begin{array}{c|c}
\text{Time (seconds)} & \text{Number of colonies} \\\hline
0 & 5 \\
1 & 20 \\
2 & 80 \\
3 & 320
\end{array}\]
module_1.hint: Find the initial value (when \(s = 0\)) and the growth factor (ratio between consecutive values).
solution: General form: \(c = a \cdot b^s\) where \(a\) is initial value and \(b\) is growth factor

module_1.question: The equations \(12x = y\) and \(24x + 7 = 2y\) intersect at how many points when graphed in the xy-plane?
module_1.hint: Substitute the first equation into the second and check if there is a consistent solution.
solution: This is a contradiction, meaning the lines are parallel and never intersect
Therefore, there are 0 points of intersection

module_1.question: Several tiles labeled with either an A or a B are placed in a bag, and tiles are worth a different point value depending on the label. The equation \(15a + 10b = 100\) represents the situation when \(a\) of the A tiles and \(b\) of the B tiles are drawn from the bag for a total of 100 points. How many points would be earned by drawing one A tile and one B tile from the bag?
module_1.hint: The coefficients in the equation represent the point value of each tile type.
solution: The equation \(15a + 10b = 100\) shows that each A tile is worth 15 points and each B tile is worth 10 points
Drawing one A tile and one B tile: \(15 + 10 = 25\) points

module_1.question: The amount of money remaining in a scholarship fund is reduced by one-fourth every year. The amount of money in the fund is represented by \(d\) and the number of years by \(y\). If the fund starts with $10,000, which equation below represents this situation after \(y\) years?
module_1.hint: If the fund is reduced by one-fourth, then three-fourths remains each year.
solution: Reduced by one-fourth means \(\frac{1}{4}\) is lost
After each year, the fund is multiplied by \(\frac{3}{4}\)

module_1.question: What is the diameter, in millimeters (mm), of a cylinder with a volume of \(144\pi\) mm³ and a height of 4 mm?
module_1.hint: Use the volume formula for a cylinder: \(V = \pi r^2 h\), then find the diameter.

module_1.question:
\[
\begin{align}
4x + 2y &= 4 \\
19x + 10y &= 14
\end{align}
\]

When graphed in the xy-plane, the linear equations shown above intersect at \((a, b)\). What is the value of \(a\)?
module_1.hint: Solve the system using elimination or substitution to find the x-coordinate.

module_1.question: The longest side of right triangle ABC is opposite angle B. If \(\sin(A) = \frac{9}{41}\), what is the value of \(\sin(C)\)?
module_1.hint: In a right triangle, if B is the right angle, then \(\sin(A) = \frac{\text{opposite}}{\text{hypotenuse}}\). Use the Pythagorean theorem to find the adjacent side.
solution: The longest side is the hypotenuse, so angle B is the right angle (\(90°\))
Given: \(\sin(A) = \frac{9}{41}\), so opposite to A = 9, hypotenuse = 41
In a right triangle, \(A + C = 90°\), so \(\sin(C) = \cos(A)\)

module_1.question: Function \(g\) reaches its maximum value when \(x = a\). If \(g(x) = -6x^2 - 30x - 24\), what is the value of \(a\)?
module_1.hint: For a quadratic in the form \(ax^2 + bx + c\), the x-coordinate of the vertex is \(x = -\frac{b}{2a}\).
solution: The x-coordinate of the maximum is: \(x = -\frac{b}{2a}\)

module_1.question:
\(f(x) = -\frac{1}{5}x - 3\)

The linear function \(f(x)\), given above, is perpendicular to \(g(x)\) when graphed in the xy-plane. If \(g(0) = 0\), what is the value of \(g(2)\)?
module_1.hint: Perpendicular lines have slopes that are negative reciprocals. Find the slope of \(g(x)\), then use the point \((0, 0)\) to write the equation.
solution: Since \(g(0) = 0\), the line passes through the origin: \(g(x) = 5x\)

module_1.question:
\[
\begin{align}
y &= 5kx^2 + 2x + 3 \\
\frac{y}{10} &= -x
\end{align}
\]

The system of equations above has exactly one solution. If \(k\) is a positive constant, what is the value of \(k\)?
module_1.hint: For the system to have exactly one solution, the discriminant of the resulting quadratic must equal zero.

module_2_easy.question: In the line formed by the equation \(y + 5 = 7x\), what is the value of the y-intercept?
module_2_easy.hint: Rewrite the equation in slope-intercept form \(y = mx + b\), where \(b\) is the y-intercept.
solution: In the form \(y = mx + b\), the y-intercept is \(b = -5\)

module_2_easy.question: Twenty students were asked the combined total number of servings of fruits and vegetables they have each day. The results show: 1 student had 1 serving, 1 student had 2 servings, 2 students had 3 servings, 3 students had 4 servings, 2 students had 5 servings, 4 students had 6 servings, 4 students had 7 servings, 2 students had 8 servings, and 1 student had 10 servings. What is the median number of servings of fruits and vegetables consumed each day?
module_2_easy.hint: The median is the middle value when data is ordered. With 20 students, find the average of the 10th and 11th values.
solution: For 20 values, median = average of 10th and 11th values

module_2_easy.question: Which of the following is equivalent to \(\frac{x^2 - 81}{x + 9}\)?
module_2_easy.hint: Factor the numerator as a difference of squares, then simplify.
solution: Recognize \(x^2 - 81\) as a difference of squares: \(x^2 - 9^2\)

module_2_easy.question: A line passes through the points \((0, 4)\) and \((3, 6)\). What is the best approximation of the slope of this line?
module_2_easy.hint: Use the slope formula: \(m = \frac{y_2 - y_1}{x_2 - x_1}\).

module_2_easy.question: Walter is going backpacking on a trail. The total distance of the trail is 300 miles. If he has already traveled 100 miles on the trail, how many miles per day, \(m\), will he need to travel in order to complete his journey in \(D\) days?
module_2_easy.hint: Find the remaining distance, then divide by the number of days.
solution: Miles per day: \(m = \frac{\text{remaining distance}}{\text{number of days}} = \frac{200}{D}\)

module_2_easy.question: Which of the following expressions is equivalent to \(2(x - 4) + 4\)?
module_2_easy.hint: Distribute the 2, then combine like terms.

module_2_easy.question: The number of dollars, \(C\), it costs for Halle to run a restaurant is modeled by the function \(C(m) = 10m + 10{,}000\) in which \(m\) is the number of meals served. What is the meaning of the 10 in this function?

options.A: The total cost for all the meals sold.
options.B: The fixed costs for the restaurant to operate.
options.C: The profit the restaurant has for each meal sold.
options.D: The additional cost to the restaurant for each additional meal

module_2_easy.hint: In the linear function \(C(m) = 10m + 10{,}000\), the coefficient of \(m\) represents the rate of change.
solution: The term \(10m\) represents the variable cost (depends on number of meals)
The coefficient 10 means each additional meal adds $10 to the total cost
The 10,000 is the fixed cost (independent of meals served)

module_2_easy.question: Which of the following represents the graph of \(\frac{1}{2}y + 2 = -x\)?

options.A: A line with y-intercept at \(-4\) and slope \(-2\)
options.B: A line with y-intercept at \(-2\) and slope \(\frac{1}{2}\)
options.C: A line with y-intercept at \(-1\) and slope \(2\)
options.D: A line with y-intercept at \(-1\) and slope \(-1\)

module_2_easy.hint: Solve for \(y\) to get slope-intercept form \(y = mx + b\).

module_2_easy.question: In a survey of 1,000 likely voters, \(\frac{1}{2}\) like Candidate A, \(\frac{1}{3}\) like Candidate B, and the remainder like neither candidate. If a likely voter is selected at random, what is the probability that they will like neither candidate?
module_2_easy.hint: Find the fraction of voters who like either candidate, then subtract from 1.

module_2_easy.question: A silverware drawer has a total of 80 forks and spoons. If there are 5 forks for every 3 spoons, how many forks are there in the drawer?
module_2_easy.hint: Use the ratio to set up an equation. If there are 5 forks for every 3 spoons, the total parts are 5 + 3 = 8.

module_2_easy.question: A bar graph shows traffic density (in vehicles per mile per lane) over time. The densities are: 7:00 AM (20), 9:00 AM (40), 11:00 AM (30), 1:00 PM (25), 3:00 PM (30), 5:00 PM (42), 7:00 PM (44), 9:00 PM (28). Between what two hours does the traffic density increase the most?
module_2_easy.hint: Calculate the change in traffic density for each interval.
solution: The largest increase is 20, occurring between 7 a.m. and 9 a.m.

module_2_easy.question: In the system of inequalities \(y + 10 \leq 3x\) and \(x \leq -y - 2\), what is the maximum value of \(y\)?
module_2_easy.hint: Find the intersection point of the boundary lines \(y + 10 = 3x\) and \(x = -y - 2\).
solution: Check the feasible region: the maximum \(y\) in the intersection is \(-6\)

module_2_easy.question: A meal costs \(x\) dollars. The sales tax on the meal is 7%. If the cashier accidentally subtracted the sales tax from the price of the meal instead of adding it, what would the price be in terms of \(x\)?
module_2_easy.hint: The sales tax is 7% of \(x\), which is \(0.07x\). Subtract this from \(x\).

module_2_easy.question: Ken's commute takes 25 more minutes in the evening than it does in the morning. If his total daily commute takes 95 minutes, how long does his morning commute take in minutes?
module_2_easy.hint: Let \(m\) be the morning commute time. The evening commute is \(m + 25\). Their sum is 95.

module_2_easy.question: The function \(f\) is determined by \(f(x) = \frac{x^3}{4} + 3\). What is the value of \(f(2)\)?
module_2_easy.hint: Substitute \(x = 2\) into the function and calculate.

module_2_easy.question: If the volume of a right rectangular prism is 90 cubic inches, and the product of the length and width of the prism is 30 square inches, what is the height of the prism?
module_2_easy.hint: Volume formula for a rectangular prism: \(V = l \times w \times h\).
solution: Given: \(V = 90\) cubic inches and \(l \times w = 30\) square inches

module_2_easy.question:
\(x^2 - x - 20 = 0\)

What is the sum of the solutions to the equation above?
module_2_easy.hint: For a quadratic \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\), the sum of solutions is \(-\frac{b}{a}\).

module_2_easy.question: A circle graph shows votes in favor of a tax levy. Of 800 city residents who voted, the central angle formed by the portion allocated to "NO" is \(45°\). How many of the residents voted "NO"?
module_2_easy.hint: A full circle is \(360°\). Find what fraction \(45°\) is of \(360°\), then multiply by the total voters.

module_2_easy.question:
Density, mass, and volume are related by this formula: \(\text{Density} = \frac{\text{Mass}}{\text{Volume}}\)

If the mass of an object is 2 kilograms and its volume is 8 liters, what is the object's density in kg/L?
module_2_easy.hint: Substitute the given values into the density formula and simplify.

module_2_easy.question: What percentage of 70 is 35?
module_2_easy.hint: Divide the part by the whole and multiply by 100 to get the percentage.

module_2_easy.question: A line that is perpendicular to the line with the equation \(y = -3x + 5\) has a y-intercept of 4. What is the y-value of a point in this perpendicular line when its x-value is 3?
module_2_easy.hint: Perpendicular lines have slopes that are negative reciprocals. Find the slope of the perpendicular line, then use the y-intercept to write its equation.

module_2_easy.question: In triangle ABC, angle C is a right angle. AC is 24 units long and BC is 7 units long. What is the cosine of \(\angle ABC\)?
module_2_easy.hint: First find the hypotenuse using the Pythagorean theorem. Then use the cosine ratio: adjacent/hypotenuse.
solution: Use Pythagorean theorem to find AB (hypotenuse): \(AB^2 = AC^2 + BC^2\)
For \(\angle ABC\), the adjacent side is BC = 7

module_2_hard.question: Hoping to gauge public support for an upcoming local referendum, a political pollster surveys a random sample of 560 registered voters within the municipality in question. Based on the results of the survey, the pollster predicts, with a 4.4% margin of error, that 60% of registered voters will support the referendum. Based on this information, which conclusion can most reasonably be drawn with respect to the upcoming referendum?

options.A: 4.4% of registered voters will support the referendum.
options.B: 60% of registered voters will support the referendum.
options.C: It is likely that between 55.6% and 64.4% of registered voters will support the referendum.
options.D: It is likely that less than 55.6% of registered voters will support the referendum.

module_2_hard.hint: The margin of error creates a confidence interval around the predicted value.
solution: The most reasonable conclusion is that support is likely between 55.6% and 64.4%

module_2_hard.question: What is the length of one side of a right triangle, in inches, if the length of the hypotenuse of the triangle is 12 inches and the length of the other side is 7 inches?
module_2_hard.hint: Use the Pythagorean theorem: \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\), where \(c\) is the hypotenuse.
solution: Let the unknown side be \(a\), given: \(b = 7\) and \(c = 12\)

module_2_hard.question: In the xy-plane, the graph of \(y = f(x)\) for the linear function \(f\) passes through the points \((6, 26)\) and \((12, 28)\). Which of the following equations defines function \(f\)?
module_2_hard.hint: Find the slope using the two points, then use point-slope form to find the y-intercept.

module_2_hard.question: The ages of six children are: 7, 7, 8, 10, 12, 12. What is the median of these ages?
module_2_hard.hint: The median is the middle value when data is ordered. With an even number of values, average the two middle values.
solution: With 6 values, median = average of 3rd and 4th values

module_2_hard.question: A baker can bake a maximum of 50 layers of cake in one day. This includes 10-layer wedding cakes and birthday cakes with either 2 layers or 3 layers. Which of the following inequalities represents the possible combinations of 2-layer birthday cakes (\(b\)) and 3-layer birthday cakes (\(c\)) that the baker can bake in one day, given that the baker bakes 1 wedding cake, \(b\) 2-layer birthday cakes, \(c\) 3-layer birthday cakes, and no other items that day?
module_2_hard.hint: Calculate the layers used by the wedding cake, then determine the maximum layers available for birthday cakes.

module_2_hard.question:
\[
\begin{align}
3y &= 7x \\
y - 5 &= 4x
\end{align}
\]

Which ordered pair \((x, y)\) is the solution to the given system of equations?
module_2_hard.hint: From the first equation, express \(y\) in terms of \(x\), then substitute into the second equation.

module_2_hard.question:
\[
\begin{align}
y &= x^2 - 6x - 18 \\
y &= -x + 6
\end{align}
\]

A solution to the given system of equations can be expressed as \((a, b)\). If \(a < 0\), what is the value of \(a\)?
module_2_hard.hint: Set the two equations equal to each other and solve the resulting quadratic equation.

module_2_hard.question: Two employees at a jewelry store are weighing identical pieces of jewelry. The first employee weighs 4 pairs of earrings and 2 necklaces and obtains a weight of 38.8 grams. The second employee weighs 1 pair of earrings and 5 necklaces and obtains a weight of 42.1 grams. What is the weight, in grams, of 1 pair of earrings?
module_2_hard.hint: Set up a system of equations with \(e\) for earring weight and \(n\) for necklace weight.
solution: Let \(e\) = weight of 1 pair of earrings, \(n\) = weight of 1 necklace

module_2_hard.question:
\[
\begin{align}
y &= 7(x + 13)^2 - 19 \\
y &= -13
\end{align}
\]

At how many points do the graphs of the given equations intersect in the xy-plane?
module_2_hard.hint: Set the equations equal and solve for \(x\). The number of real solutions indicates the number of intersection points.
solution: This gives two distinct real solutions for \(x\)
Therefore, the graphs intersect at exactly two points

module_2_hard.question: An opening-day promotion at a hobby shop gave a consistent number of free trading cards to each customer who visited between 10:00 A.M. and 11:00 A.M. The relationship between \(t\), the total number of trading cards the store started with, and \(c\), the number of customers who entered the store between 10:00 A.M. and 11:00 A.M., is given by the equation \(t - 3c = 132\). What is the best interpretation of the number 3 in this equation?

options.B: The shop had 3 trading cards remaining at 11:00 A.M.
options.C: The shop started with 3 trading cards at 10:00 A.M.
options.D: 3 customers visited the store between 10:00 A.M. and 11:00 A.M.

module_2_hard.hint: The coefficient of \(c\) represents the rate at which cards were given per customer.
solution: This means: total cards = (3 cards per customer × number of customers) + 132 remaining
The coefficient 3 represents the number of cards each customer received

module_2_hard.question: A line is graphed in the xy-plane. If the line has an x-intercept of \((20, 0)\) and a slope of \(-\frac{1}{4}\), what is the y-coordinate of the y-intercept of the line?
module_2_hard.hint: Use the point-slope form with the x-intercept and slope to find the y-intercept.

module_2_hard.question:
\(-5(x + 14) = 5(14 - x)\)

How many solutions does the given equation have?
module_2_hard.hint: Expand both sides and simplify to see if you get a true statement, false statement, or an equation in \(x\).
solution: Therefore, the equation has zero solutions

module_2_hard.question:
\[
\begin{align}
3d + 8n &= 24n - 14 \\
14 + 3d &= kn
\end{align}
\]

In the given system of equations, \(k\) is a constant. If the system of equations has infinitely many solutions, what is the value of \(k\)?
module_2_hard.hint: For infinitely many solutions, the two equations must be equivalent. Simplify the first equation and compare coefficients.
solution: For the equations to be equivalent: \(kn = 16n\)

module_2_hard.question: Which of the following quadratic equations has exactly two real solutions?
module_2_hard.hint: Use the discriminant \(b^2 - 4ac\). Two real solutions occur when the discriminant is positive.

module_2_hard.question:
\(g(x) = (0.35)^{x/5}\)

The function \(g\) is defined by the given equation, which can be rewritten as \(g(x) = \left(1 - \frac{n}{100}\right)^x\) where \(n\) is a constant. Which of the following is closest to the value of \(n\)?
In the figure, triangles VWX and VYZ are similar. Given that \(VW = 6\) units, \(YZ = 15\) units, and \(VZ = \sqrt{549}\) units, what is the area, in square units, of triangle VWX?
module_2_hard.hint: Use the ratio of corresponding sides to find the dimensions of triangle VWX, then calculate its area.
solution: Triangles VWX and VYZ are similar
Corresponding sides: \(\frac{VW}{VY}\) is the scale factor
In triangle VYZ: Use Pythagorean theorem with \(VZ = \sqrt{549}\) and \(YZ = 15\)
Wait, let me recalculate using area ratio: \((\frac{1}{3})^2 = \frac{1}{9}\)
Hmm, but answer might be 18. Let me verify VY calculation again.
Let me think: if VW = 6 and scale is 1/3, then WX should also scale. Area = 18 makes sense.

module_2_hard.question: The graph of \(y = -x^2 + bx + c\) is shown. The parabola has a vertex at \((1, 4)\) and passes through \((0, 3)\). If \(b\) and \(c\) are constants, what is the value of \(b - c\)?
module_2_hard.hint: Use the vertex and a point on the parabola to find \(b\) and \(c\), then calculate \(b - c\).
solution: From the graph, y-intercept is at \((0, 3)\), so \(c = 3\)

module_2_hard.question: The graph of \(y = g(x) - 14\) is shown as a line passing through \((0, -6)\) with slope 3. If \(a\) is a positive constant and \(b\) is a negative constant, the function \(g\) could be defined by which of the following equations?
module_2_hard.hint: From the graph, find the equation of \(y = g(x) - 14\), then solve for \(g(x)\).
solution: The graphed line has slope 3 and y-intercept -6: \(y = 3x - 6\)
Given \(a > 0\) and \(b < 0\), check which option matches \(3x + 8\):
Option C: \(g(x) = a - bx\). Since \(b < 0\), \(-b > 0\), so \(a - bx = a + |b|x\)

module_2_hard.question: A circle has center O with coordinates \((h, k)\) when graphed in the xy-plane. Point Y lies on the circle and has coordinates \((h + \sqrt{111}, k - 2)\). If point X also lies on the circle, and the measure of angle XOY is \(90°\), what is the length of XY?
module_2_hard.hint: Find the radius using point Y, then use the fact that triangle XOY is a right isosceles triangle.
solution: Find radius using distance from O to Y: \(r = \sqrt{(\sqrt{111})^2 + (-2)^2} = \sqrt{111 + 4} = \sqrt{115}\)
Since angle XOY = 90° and OX = OY = r (radii), triangle XOY is a right isosceles triangle

module_2_hard.question: When the quantity \(n\) is decreased by 150%, the result is \(-90\). What is the value of \(n\)?
module_2_hard.hint: Decreasing by 150% means subtracting 1.5 times the original value.

module_2_hard.question: For data set A, a scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, \(x\) and \(y\). A line of best fit is also shown with equation approximately \(y = 71.8 - 0.9x\). Data set B is created by dividing the y-coordinate of each data point from data set A by 5.2. Which of the following is closest to the equation of a line of best fit for data set B?
module_2_hard.hint: When all y-values are divided by a constant, both the y-intercept and slope are divided by that constant.

module_2_hard.question: Pressure is defined in physics as the amount of force applied perpendicular to the surface of an object divided by the area over which that force is distributed. As part of the design test for an automotive part, two flat circular discs are placed on a flat surface. A constant pressure of 50 pascals is applied simultaneously straight down onto the surface of the two discs. The smaller disc has a radius that is \(\frac{1}{4}\) of the radius of the larger disc. If the amount of force on the two circular discs combined is \(3{,}400\pi\) newtons, what is the amount of force, in newtons, on the smaller circular disc, to the nearest integer?
module_2_hard.hint: Use \(\text{Pressure} = \frac{\text{Force}}{\text{Area}}\) and the area formula for circles \(A = \pi r^2\).
solution: Let \(R\) = radius of larger disc, then smaller disc radius = \(\frac{R}{4}\)
Force on smaller disc: \(F_S = P \times A_S = 50 \times 4\pi = 200\pi \approx 628\) newtons
